msContents.summary: The Mahāvastu or Mahāvastu avadānam is an early Buddhist text of the Lokottaravādin sect. This manuscript was used by Émile Senart in his 1882 critical edition, where he gave it the siglum M, named for its previous owner, Ivan Minayev. Senart states that this manuscript and MS ADD 1339 from the Cambridge University Library derive from a common source. Both are relatively recent manuscripts from Nepal.

msItem.title: Mahāvastu
msItem.incipit:
mahāvastune ādi || bandhānīmāni bodhisatvānāṃ bodhisatvacaryā
ṇi || katamāni catvāri || prakṛticaryyā praṇidhānacaryyā anulomacaryyā anivarttanacaryyā ||
msItem.explicit:
idam avocad bhagavān āttamanāya ca devāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragā sā ca sarvāvatī varṣat te ca bhikṣavo≡
bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti ||
msItem.finalRubric: āryyamahāsāṃghikānāṃ lokottaravādināṃ pāṭhena iti śrīmahāvastu avadānaṃ samāptaṃ ||
msItem.colophon:
ye dharmmā hetuprabhāvā he
tun teṣāṃ tathāgataḥ | hy avadat teṣāṃ ca yo nirodhaḥ evaṃvādī mahāśravaṇaḥ || yaḥ śṛṇoti mune dharmmaṃ śrutvā cābhiniveśati | sarvapāpaṃ vinimukto sū gacchati su
khāvatīṃ || śrotavyaṃ śraddhayā tasmāt sugatsyāyaṃ subhāṣitaṃ | nānāvidarśanais tais taiḥ jinena bhāṣitaḥ purā || so yaṃ subhāṣito bhaktyā sugatasyānubhā≡
ṣitaḥ | mayā saṃpūrṇṇalikhitaṃ kaivalyavatmadeśakaḥ || ato yat mama puṇo na sarvakilviṣanāśanaṃ | apāyadvāranāśārhaṃ bodhimārgopadeśakaṃ || tena
puṇyānubhāvena sarvabhūtāni sarvaśaḥ || sarvakleśavinimuktā prayāntu hi sukhāvatīṃ || ye satvā andhā kāṇāṃ ca tathā kubjā vicitratā | anye pipāsitā kṣu
ddhāḥ sarvaduḥkhanipīḍitāḥ || tena puṇyāna te sarve bhavet sukhasamanvitāḥ | vividhā bhogasaṃbhuktā labhantu mokṣam avyayaṃ || ṣaṭsu gatīṣu ye satvāḥ magnā
jātijalākula | te sarve mama puṇyena bhavantu bodhimārgagāḥ || ye satvāḥ vārajātīye saddharmeṇa vivarjitāḥ | pāpeṣu śatato śaktvāḥ rāgadveṣeṇa mo
hitā || te sarve mama puṇyena bhūyo jātismarās sadā | dānaśīlādisaṃyuktā carantu bodhicārakāṃ || rājā bhavattu kṣemāvān_ carantu mantriṇo naye | vīrā
bhavattu satataṃ saṃgrāme jitaśatrave || kāle varṣantu meghāś ca śasyapūrṇṇo mahī sadā || etan me praṇidhānena yat puṇyaṃ jāyate śubhaṃ || tena puṇyānubhā
vena bhaveyaṃ bodhipāragāḥ || saṃsārārṇṇavatīrṇṇāya dehināṃ kuśalāya ca || ❈ || || śubham astu sarvadā || ❈ ||

decoNote.desc: At the end of the manuscript, there is a decoration resembling the "half" puṣpikā as described in Bhattarai 2020, 170).

provenance.p: According to Senart, the manuscript previously belonged to Ivan Minayev.
